greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers k such that A073142(n) = f^k(A073142(n)), where f: m -> |m - reverse(m)|.
comment: Presumably a(6) = 17. a(n) is the length of the periodic part (cf. A072137) of the trajectory of A073142(n). Question: Does every k > 0 appear in this sequence?
example: a(3) = 14 since A073142(2) = 11436678 is the smallest solution of x = f^14(x).
results.author: _Klaus Brockhaus_, Jul 17 2002
ext: Offset changed by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 01 2007
